page.title: 20PEOPLE OF PENTIRE & CRANTOCK
page.content: 97 pupils (aged 7-11) gathered the information about the Crantock/Pentire area and held some 70 interviews over a period of 3.5 days. We were all pleased with the way in which both residents and visitors helped us. Everyone was interested and very coop- erative - there was only 1 who was too busy!!! The National Trust Warden was very helpful and spent 2 full mornings out and about with us. Besides learn- ing about the wildlife and wildflowers of the area we also learnt how he maintains paths, stiles and walls and how the Trust looks after the sand- dunes to stop them 'burying' Crantock village. 32 parents drove us around - and were amazed at what they learnt ! - and the amount of information we collected. We enjoyed the project and are looking forward to following up much of the interesting information.
